name: grape production | grape | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/19475/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of fresh Grape which is a peripheral crop harvested in the month of March, 2017 at a farm located in village Vadner Bhairav, District Nashik of Maharashtra. The farm has a yield of 22,500 kg fresh matter per ha for this crop cycle. Harvesting date is 02-March, 2017. Mineral NPK fertilizer input is 49.63-115.63-226.41 kg/ha. Organic fertilizer applied amounts to 32,500 kg of manure from cattle dung and Geogreen. Herbicides used has active ingredient as Oxyfluorfen 150g/ha. The fungicides used have active ingredients as Copper (Cu) 487.50 g/ha, Cymoxanil 195.00 g/ha, Dimethomorph 203.13 g/ha, Fluopicolide 111.00 g/ha, Fluopyram 88.50 g/ha, Fosetyl 1,666.75 g/ha, Hexaconazole 40.63 g/ha, Mancozeb 7,349.06 g/ha, Metalaxil 81.25 g/ha, Propineb 1,137.50 g/ha, Sulfur 650.00 g/ha, Tebuconazole 88.50 g/ha, Zineb 2,437.50 g/ha, and Ziram 548.44 g/ha. Insecticides used have active ingredients Abamectin 7.72 g/ha,  Alphamethrin 121.88 g/ha,  Buprofezin 357.50 g/ha,  Dichlorvos 617.50 g/ha,  Imidacloprid 180.78 g/ha,  Lambda-cyhalothrin 40.63 g/ha, and Thiamethoxam 50.78 g/ha. Machinery is used for plant protection with fuel consumption of 71.76 kg/ha for pesticides spray. 

This is a perennial crop with periodic harvesting.

The activity ends with the harvesting of the mature Grapes from the Grape plant.
category: A:Agriculture, forestry and fishing/01:Crop and animal production, hunting and related service activities/012:Growing of perennial crops/0121:Growing of grapes

processDocumentation.timeDescription: Harvesting date main crop: 02-March, 2017. The soil cultivation, sowing and harvesting dates are taken as the middle date of the week or fortnight told to the data collector by the farmer. The data is collected for one crop cycle. The cycle of one year is considered for entry in ecoeditor.
processDocumentation.geographyDescription: village -Vadner Bhairav , District Nashik of Maharashtra
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Cultivation of Grape follows conventional production standards
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: Ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production was used to calculate field emissions from the cultivation process.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: The farmer was identified and contacted by agriculture science faculty familiar with the local farmers in the region. Data was collected directly from the farmer through semi-structured interview using a questionnaire based on the input requirements of the ecoinvent LCI calculation tool for crop production.

Total amount of active substance/s of pesticides needed for the production of grape is calculated to be circa 1.72E-03 kg. Pesticide/s used in this dataset is/are: '[sulfonyl]urea-compound', '[thio]carbamate-compound', 'acetamide-anillide-compound, unspecified', 'borax, anhydrous, powder', 'copper oxide', 'cyclic N-compound', 'dithiocarbamate-compound', 'fosetyl-Al', 'mancozeb', 'organophosphorus-compound, unspecified', 'pesticide, unspecified', 'portafer', 'pyrethroid-compound', 'sulfite', 'sulfur', 'zinc monosulfate'. The total amount of active substance/s is doubled in order to account for the packaging of the dilluted product of pesticide/s that is/are applied. Therefore, 3.44E-03 kg of packaging for pesticides is justified with this exchange.
